channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Her kids will have no inheritance’: Will my friend lose her house to Medicaid if she goes into a nursing home?
item.description: “She would like to leave her kids something after she dies.”

item.title: Broadcom is starting to look ‘eerily reminiscent’ of Nvidia. Both stocks are feeling the impact.
item.description: The company said it added a fourth customer for its custom chips. Some analysts now think the company’s AI revenue will double next year.

item.title: My friend and her second husband own property. How do her kids from her first marriage get their fair share?
item.description: “They are joint tenants with the right of survivorship.”

item.title: U.S. unemployment rate jumps to nearly 4-year high as weak job creation in August tees up Fed rate cut
item.description: The economy added a lackluster 22,000 new jobs in August and the unemployment rate rose to a nearly four-year high, underscoring the increasing fragil...

item.title: Here’s what Elon Musk must do to become a Tesla trillionaire
item.description: Tesla proposes a $1 trillion pay package for Elon Musk, if can stay focused on adding $7.5 trillion to the company’s value.

item.title: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway, Walmart among the companies with the most to gain from deploying AI
item.description: Adam Parker and the Trivector team look at companies with a high employee count and low margins.

item.title: Analysts bail on Lululemon after guidance missed Wall Street estimates
item.description: Many analysts are skeptical that a turnaround in Lululemon's U.S. product offerings will be swift enough to warrant conviction on the stock.

item.title: Bank of America initiates Paramount Skydance at underperform, says 'big picture is cloudy'
item.description: Analyst Jessica Ehrlich said the stock's risk-reward ratio appears unfavorable in the near term.

item.title: Broadcom is soaring after an earnings beat. What Wall Street analysts are saying
item.description: Broadcom's fiscal third-quarter report is being well-received by Wall Street analysts, several of whom lifted their price targets on the chipmaker.

item.title: UBS upgrades ASML, says chipmaker is headed towards 'inflection point'
item.description: The firm lifted its rating on the Netherlands-based chipmaker to buy from neutral, partly given its renewed optimism on ASML's lithography business.
